The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: This game had an almost insurmountable task of following the first\, but manages to do so in an unexpected and innovative way. Gameplay\, graphics\, and sound are as impressive as the first\, and shows a natural evolution despite some predictable human A.I. The story structure was completely unique. The revenge cliche still feels like a slight drawback\, but the way it’s done makes it so much more than that. Perhaps even more than the first\, this is a game of consequences. It’s about different experiences from different perspectives. How Joel’s choices impacted Ellie’s and Abby’s\, into how Abby’s impacts Ellie’s\, and how Ellie’s impacts Abby’s. There’s no one to root for in this game\, and that will leave a bad taste in some peoples mouths. I feel like Ellie killing Abby May have been a more logical ending\, though it has left me wondering what’s next for these characters. This is a complicated story that will hit each player differently. 9.5/10… Expand
